value.title: How China Kept Its Supermarkets Stocked as Coronavirus Raged
value.excerpt: Two months into the coronavirus epidemic in China, many people are still under quarantine and much of the economy remains in a deep freeze, yet it has largely succeeded in keeping stores filled with food and other essentials.

value.excerpt: BEIJING — China is pushing a new theory about the origins of the coronavirus: It is an American disease that might have been introduced by members of the United States Army who visited Wuhan in October. value.title: New COVID-19 cases fall in China; 64,000 have been treated, released
value.excerpt: Nations worldwide increased efforts Friday to fight off the spread of the coronavirus, as China reported its lowest daily number of new infections since the beginning of the crisis in December. China's National Health Commission reported eight new cases of COVID-19 and seven deaths in its daily update.

value.title: China to Free Up Cash for Bank Lending to Coronavirus-Hit Businesses
value.excerpt: China’s central bank said it would lower the amount of cash that banks are required to set aside for reserves in a bid to boost lending to small businesses hurt by the coronavirus pandemic.

value.title: UPDATE 2-China's coronavirus epicentre of Wuhan sees single-digit new cases for second day

value.title: Lower Open Anticipated For Hong Kong Shares
value.excerpt: (RTTNews) - The Hong Kong stock market has finished lower in two straight sessions, plunging more than 1,080 points or 4.1 percent along the way. The Hang Seng Index now rests just above the 24,300-point plateau and it's expected to see further downside again on Friday.

value.title: Gordon G. Chang: China falsely blames US for coronavirus pandemic
value.excerpt: China needs an enemy to blame because the Communist Party’s inhumane and incompetent handling of the coronavirus outbreak has left many Chinese people white-hot angry. To make matters worse for leaders in Beijing, many Chinese believe the virus either was deliberately released or accidentally escaped from the Wuhan Institute of Virology ...

value.title: Apple reopens 42 China stores following coronavirus closures
value.excerpt: Well, specifically, the 42 stores in China it ordered closed in response to the coronavirus pandemic are back in business. According to Bloomberg reporter Mark Gurman, as of tomorrow local time the Apple stores will be reopened. "Apple confirms all 42 of its stores in mainland China will have re-opened as of Friday local time," reports Gurman.

value.title: Hong Kong Church Streams Mass Online to Prevent Coronavirus Spread
value.excerpt: With an iPad on a small tripod, Father Thomas Law of Our Lady of Mount Carmel Catholic Church in downtown Hong Kong is broadcasting mass to worshippers to their homes via online streaming as a way to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.

images.title: Hong Kong Church Streams Mass Online to Prevent Coronavirus Spread

value.title: China Ramps Up Efforts to Boost Consumption as Virus Hurts Economy
value.excerpt: China's state planner on Friday announced guidelines to boost residents' property income and improve consumer market supply, in an effort to promote consumption as the coronavirus crisis takes a toll on the economy.

images.title: China Ramps Up Efforts to Boost Consumption as Virus Hurts Economy
